column4: here's an interesting thought: what if in an almost-out-of-memory condition, Ubuntu would pop up a notification balloon asking if you want to create/enlarge your swapfile?
we don't control gnome development in here,
besides if you are at that level where you are swapping out to disk, your machine will be at such a slow pace, you'll know your machine is out of ram
your machine will be on it's knees, doing a partition resize would not be wise
you don't need to mess with partitions, just create a big empty file and mark it as swap
if you are at that level where you have no ram left, you won't need a bubble to advise you, you have no ram left
you're already swapping to disk - the effort in creating another swap file would not be helpful
think it through if it was a good idea....it would be in place by now
swapping out userspace ram is different

as if your machine is at a level where you have no ram left and you are swapping to disk already, the function of creating a swap file would add more load and not change the problem, the problem would be you don't have enough ram to do what you want
a swap file is not a ram replacment
either way, we don't control gnome development here, if you think it's a good idea, stick it on brainstorm.ubuntu.com
